messages.title: Campaining for you... and for a future for your children by:

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Complete a local genuinely affordable greenfield housing project to stimulate the development of a new community of up to 5000 homes.
Campaign focuses on financial advice to residential homeowners through Local Community Hubs where we all work, supported by Local Authorities' infrastructure.
Campaign for Waverley to plan Extra Care Housing to accommodate our growing senior population, and relieve pressure on NHS and caring services.
Invest £8bn to improve our NHS and we will invest more in mental care for mental health. No hits on NHS in TTIP
Cut your taxes by an additional £400 by raising the tax-free allowance to £12,500.
Balance the budget fairly and invest in a high skill, low carbon economy.
Guarantee education and qualified teachers in every class.
Protect nature and fight climate change with Five Green Laws.

issues.governance: The Neighbourhood Plan has a real role to say which development goes ahead and which one does not.

housing.content: Complete a local genuinely affordable greenfield housing project and has campaigned to support development on brownfield sites first.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Patrick has campaigned to halt the decline of small business premises in Haslemere, supports local sports with practical funding, played a key role in rescuing Haslemere's Blue Plaque heritage. Also focuses on road safety and hitting potholes repair targets, protects playing pitches and funding youth community projects, and endorses the '20's plenty' campaign for safer roads. He wants to strengthen local democracy and implement community infrastructure payments.
